fields.description:
*Summary:* My (developer, non-admin) team needs the ability to create *and* merge (after getting PR approvals) release/* & hotfix/* branches. My team should *not* be able to push directly to develop, master, hotfix/* or release/* branches.

h2. According to the documentation, that should not be a problem.
I think there's a bug.\\
Here's why:

According to this documentation, Branch Permissions should _not_ prevent users from creating a branch:

!108829411-Screen%20Shot%202017-11-15%20at%208.17.59%20AM.png|thumbnail!

h2. Repository write permissions exist for the group we need this functionality for:
!531058245-Screen%20Shot%202017-11-15%20at%209.19.50%20AM.png|thumbnail!

h2. This describes exactly what we need:
!1360696521-Screen%20Shot%202017-11-15%20at%202.28.49%20PM.png|thumbnail!

h2. But when we set it to that, we can no longer create a branch:
_(yes I'd normally create a hotfix from master, but this was a test)_\\
!3633700960-Screen%20Shot%202017-11-15%20at%209.27.39%20AM.png|thumbnail!

Please help. For auditing purposes, it is very important that no one can accidentally push to these branches directly.

Thanks in advance!!!
fields.summary: Branch permission to create (but not update) branches

In this commit dd4cadbe04c267a4ce600f0e594331a99374a3c2 appear the files and changes for example there a file  "configuration\gsrc\ar\com\sura\cc\util\activity\ActivityUtilSura.gs".

When I search the log commit, I don't find where the files were deleted and the person who did the merge didn't delete the files manually.

Could you check this case and told me what is the cause to warrant dont ocurre again.

Thank you so much.

fields.description:
According to documentation anyone with "write" access to repository can run manual steps.

What if I want only some users to be able to run manual steps?

For example, I don't want to allow everyone to deploy to production. I think there should be some permissions configuration, ideally for each step separately (or at least per branch), so I can allow deployment to staging for everyone, but only specific users would be able to deploy to production.
fields.summary: Permissions to trigger manual steps in Pipelines

Hi.

When I delete a branch in bitbucket it disappears from the web front end tool however when I issue git branch -r the branch is still present.

This makes it very difficult to keep our repo clean. I have tested and confirmed that this happens for branches with commits and without commits.

Some branches do seem to delete e.g. after a merged pull request using the close branch feature however from what I can see using the delete branch drop down on the branch directly does not seem to delete from the repo.

Please advise.

fields.description:
We are *missing bugs* that reviewers reported in BitBucket Pull Requests -- due to a nuance of this tool.  We like this tool!  But please help us catch _all_ of the bugs we report.

h3. PROBLEM DESCRIPTION:
During a Pull Request (PR), our natural inclination is to review a file from top to bottom.  The Overview page is listed in reverse chronological order of when comments were made, which would be inconvenient for a comprehensive code review with multiple files and reviewers.  So instead of using the overview page, we go straight to the Diff page, and select the files to review in order, using "Show Diff of 'All changes in this pull request'".

Unfortunately, I just learned that that setting does NOT show all the review comments if there are multiple commits.  If some comments are made in a BitBucket Pull Request, then the author uploads corrections for those comments, and then additional comments are made: not all the comments will be displayed.  If we don't realize the problem (has happened), we may never review all the comments.  Our expectation was that I would see them all, so the interface was not intuitive enough to help us get it right.

h3. POSSIBLE SOLUTIONS:
All the comments are on the Overview page, but that page is not in an efficient format for large reviews.  If it had the ability to change its sort order to "By File" in addition to the default "Reverse Chronological", we could more easily find the missing information.

Another option would be to have a Diff view that somehow marked how many unique comments exist on each commit, similar to the red circle with a white number currently employed in the top-right of my screen, that indicates the number of unapproved Pull Requests I have that are outstanding.

Another option may be to allow comments to be marked as read or resolved, and then display a "number of comments not read by reviewers" count so we can make sure it is zero before approving a PR.

Another option would be to allow a Diff View to accumulate changes and comments from multiple commits.  That sounds technically challenging, though it would be nice.

Another option may be to carry forward comments with each new commit, until they are marked resolved.  That would be neat, but seems error-prone.

Thank you for considering this problem.
fields.summary: Pull Request Comments Were Missed

fields.description:
I get the below exception when I try to push my local branch into master.

{code}
#!text

Total 0 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: error: cannot lock ref 'refs/heads/master': Unable to create '/data/c01/n08/p/vp0664/data/d-41/r-27032041/refs/heads/master.lock': File exists.
remote: 
remote: If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
remote: git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
remote: process is running and remove the file manually to continue.

{code}

* I get this exception only when pushing the master branch.
* I get this exception when pushing the master branch even from other computers.
* I get this exception even when I try to merge dev branch into master on bitbucket website directly not involving the local computer.

Because of the above 3 reasons I don't think it is a issue with my local .git folder. I can't think of what the possible cause is.

I have tried solutions available in answers to similar exceptions, but all of them are about cleaning/purging/manipulating the files in the .git folder but I get this same issue even from different computers and even on the bitbucket portal itself.

The repository is a private repository - https://bitbucket.org/chorus_nz/cfi-documentation
fields.summary: error when pushing branch into github - 'remote: error: cannot lock ref 'refs/heads/master': Unable to create'

We use Github in many of our projects, and now that one ended up using bitbucket. Their limit for files is 25Mb, and 10Mb for images, where Bitbucket has 1Mb.\\
https://help.github.com/articles/file-attachments-on-issues-and-pull-requests/

Please do consider raising the limit from 1Mb, as it would help a lot.

It would obviously be a big win if we could have support for video in some way as well.

fields.description:
The caching feature in Bitbucket Pipelines is rather inefficient. Would it be possible to implement the following?

# After a successful build, update the cache.
# Define a max TTL for the cache.

Reasoning for 1 is that at the moment any first build populates the cache and it stays effective for a week. All subsequent builds during that time window need to download dependencies over and over again. That's really inefficient.

Reasoning for 2 is that instead of forcing downloading the cache every week, why not define a time-to-live for the cache? If there are no builds running for a week, then delete the cache (if you need to free resources).

If a project is actively building day after day, do not require rebuilding the cache unless there is a good reason to do so.

I guess there is a little controversy between the interests of Atlassian and Bitbucket Pipelines users since Atlassian charges by the minute and users want builds to be as fast as possible. I'd rather pay a bit more for faster builds.
fields.summary: Configurable expiry for dependency caches to support builds with different dependencies

*Expectation:*

* The first line is not in a code block
* The lines surrounded by three backticks are in a code block

*Notes:*

* The bug is very inconsistent. Changing one letter from the example makes it go away.
* The bug isn't limited to this simple example. I originally found this when I pasted in some JSON.

fields.description:
h1. Context
Lot of people are looking for a way to have a Wiki TOC ([issue 2659|BCLOUD-2659], [issue 3230|BCLOUD-3230], and may more).

h1. Problem introduction
So the only way to create a TOC for a bitbucket wiki (listing all files of the wiki) is to use teh [creaol syntax|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/add-a-table-of-contents-to-a-wiki-221451163.html] because markdown and other markup can generate a page-level TOC only.

So to make a wiki TOC we should use: {{<<toc / 1>>}}.

Our wiki is containing {{Home.wiki}} with {{<<toc / 1>>}} and all other pages are in Markdown.

h1. Problem
The [creole TOC marco|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/macro-reference-for-creole-markup-317195809.html#MacroReferenceforCreoleMarkup-TableofContents] is not very smart. If using  {{<<toc / 1>>}}, it is looking in all markdown files for lines beginning with {{#}} BUT when using alternative markdown heading syntax like {{# H1 title #}} the macro will render a tiitle like this {{H1 title #}} with an extra {{#}} at the end that should be removed as part of the markdown syntax. This is also buggy with comments in fancy code blocks:

{code:{.markdown}}
```
# comment
puts "ruby code"
```
{code}

h1. Example
Home.wiki

{code:{.creole}}
<<toc / 1>>
{code}

file.md

{code:{.markdown}}
# Working H1

buggy code block :

```
# buggy comment
puts "ruby code"
```
{code}

file2.md

{code:{.markdown}}
# buggy H1 #

lorem
{code}

Will result in:

* Home
* Working H1
* buggy H1 #
* buggy comment

Where I must have :

* Home
* Working H1
* buggy H1
fields.summary: creole Wiki TOC bug with markdown headings

fields.description: Unable to expand code (by clicking the 3 dots) on a pull request. This has been happening to me on large files ~10000+ lines of code.
fields.summary: Unable to expand code on large files.

fields.description:
If you are set to having manual time settings on your phone, then it's possible your auth code will not be valid.

I suggest to add a help dialog under the 'Enter your auth code' menu (under 2FA Settings) before enabling 2FA that would mention to check this setting for your phone to ensure the auth codes will be valid
fields.summary: Add additional help info for time/date settings when using 2FA

fields.description:
I've noticed that redux devtools are enabled on the bitbucket site.

Probably, turning them off, at least in production mode of portal, would speed up users interface.
fields.summary: Redux dev tools

fields.description:
It would be nice to choose a single cache-definitions with provided Glob selection.

The current solution looks like this:

{code}
#!yml

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        caches:
          - root
          - service-graphql
          - service-integrations
          - service-logging
definitions:
  caches:
    root: node_modules
    service-graphql: services/graphql/node_modules
    service-integrations: services/integrations/node_modules
    service-logging: services/logging/node_modules
{code}

A more convenient solution would be to use globs as dynamic caching definitions. This is cleaner and the developer does't need to maintain the file each time a new service is added to the project.

Expectation:

{code}
#!yml

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        caches:
          - root
          - services

definitions:
  caches:
    root: node_modules
    services: services/*/node_modules
{code}
fields.summary: Pipelines cache definitions with glob support

fields.description:
When using BitBucket for large scale teams multiple projects and repositories will get created for various code bases. Each time a new repository is created every group is added to the repository. Since it is not a given that every group needs access and since organizing users into groups is the suggested way of user management this requires admins to go and remove groups after the creation. This in turn sends out notifications that users have been removed from Bitbucket when in fact they have only been removed from a certain repository. This in turn causes emails, slacks and HipChat inquiries as to why their access was removed. This seems like it could be fixed with the simple addition of adding a *Choose Groups to Add* feature in the initial repository creation.

Idea for feature:

* Add a toggle to either include all groups in the repository when it is created or choose groups to add
* If it is individual groups then allow for the groups to be checked and added into the initial repository creation
* Add a checkbox to inform or not inform the users when they have been removed from a repository
fields.summary: Admins should not have to remove groups with every new repository creation

fields.description:
When an account is over user plan limit, creating a repository shows an incorrect error message stating that the number (#) of users have group access to the account and will be given repository access by default.

However, in this account, there are no users with Group Access. These users are added directly to the private repository. This issue was encountered on an Individual Bitbucket Account.

!1277686456-1.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating repository when account is over plan limit gives incorrect error message

fields.description:
!1214560739-Screenshot_1.png|thumbnail!

After signing up usign trello i saw this screen and haven't received any email yet from Trello or bitbucket regarding confirmation. Can you please fix it. I think there is something wrong.

Also there must me a button to resend email if it didn't worked, what do you think.
fields.summary: Trello confirmation email isn't working.

fields.description: If I connect a board from Trello to Bitbucket, then delete it, it will still show up in the board list in Bitbucket. Clicking on it will show a not found page from Trello and there is no way to delete the link yet.
fields.summary: Dangling board in Bitbucket board list if deleted from Trello

fields.description:
I have just noticed that if I create a title with the title in Russian I get the URL like

https://bitbucket.org/texnic/expense-manager/issues/16/------------------------------------------
fields.summary: Issues with non-ASCII titles show just "---" in URLs

fields.description:
It would be nice to create an issue in Bitbucket and an option to create a Trello card on a board inside of a list.\\
It would also be nice to have the assignee of an issue transfer to that card
fields.summary: Bitbucket Issue to Trello Card

fields.description: If a user activates the "Reset approvals when the source branch is modified" premium feature and the pull request is approved, some change happens to the source branch, if someone made the approval again the users did not receive an email notification regarding the new approval.
fields.summary: Send a notification to previous approvers when approvals are reset due to source branch modification

fields.description:
Add an option to hide pull requests where the last activity was mine.

This covers situations like:

* I've approved the PR. (that can already be hidden)
* I've commented why I feel that I cannot approve the PR => then this get's hidden till somebody else does something on the PR.
fields.summary: Option to hide PRs where the last activity was mine

fields.description: A ticket from 2011 says this feature was added way back then, but .fs files are not properly highlighted.
fields.summary: FSharp F# syntax highlighting is incorrect

fields.description:
Received the above error while trying to merge the changes from a forked repository.\\
Similar issue as BCLOUD-8835

!3114559016-MergeForkedRepo.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Receive "Unable to merge; This field is required" error

fields.description:
when you go to a list of branches on a repository, example: https://bitbucket.org/user/repo/branches/ you dont have visibility who created the branch from this view. If you like to find out, you need to open it up, which takes time.

If we could tell right from the list who created those branches, then it would  be easier to understand who to approach to understand the situation with one or another development.
fields.summary: display creator in branch list view

fields.description: My commits on https://bitbucket.org/tomisteam/tomis-frontend/commits/all aren't showing the latest commits. I can see my latest commit at https://bitbucket.org/tomisteam/tomis-frontend/commits/b2e54f5e03e5816a702fb60beac039a9adcae19e but not on the commits view. Also, my branch "develop" isn't showing any commits on it at all and is showing as a "merged" branch, but it should be way ahead of the master branch.
fields.summary: Not showing commits made after 2017-08-15

fields.description:
Sometimes when using a squash merge instead of a commit merge the PR will remain in Open state instead of being showing as merged, however all the changes would already be implemented pointing that the merge was actually completed and successful

Customer will not be able to change the status of the PR to merged in the UI.
fields.summary: Sometimes using a squash merge vs commit merge the PR will remain in Open state

fields.summary: Cannot delete branch that contains "" characters

fields.description:
Allow customers that are using the fork workflow to add reviewers that can see the contents of their repository without having full access (comment, see images, approve)

Right now, images won't appear for users that do not have at least read access on a forked repository.
fields.summary: Images in descriptions of PRs between forks not always visible to reviewers

fields.description:
Hi

i want to delete a pipeline (configured by mistake), but it seems that there is no delete option on Pipelines. how can i delete it?
fields.summary: delete pipeline

fields.description: Hi, it would be very useful that in section branches, we can delete branches massively. For example, selecting many branches of the list with checkboxses.
fields.summary: Bulk delete branches

fields.description:
How is BCLOUD-13208 a minor priority and not a major or critical? also seems like a bug more than a proposal.

-bitbucket is pushing (and making money I assume) on pipelines\\
-bitbucket is pushing git-lfs (I assume to save space and money)\\
-Pipelines don't work with git-lfs

This is decentivizing both git-lfs and pipelines.
fields.summary: Support Git LFS in the Bitbucket Pipelines

fields.description:
In one of my repo, I enable pipelines to try the functionality. The pipelines work great but now there is a bubble notification asking me to change my plan to have more pipelines builds. The message is intrusive and annoying because it appears all the time.\\
So, now I want to remove my pipelines build or whatever to make the notification won't appear again. How can I do that?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Delete pipelines build

fields.description: Currently in a pull request when viewing a file diff on the overview tab you see an ellipsis button with the roll-over text "Show more lines" that when clicked expands the number of visible lines of the block immediately above the button. We should also have a way to similarly show more lines previous to a block.
fields.summary: pull request file diff view should have "show more lines" above a block
Partial responses are not working for branches.
CSS is weird on Pull Request page

fields.description:
After the account has run out of minutes, the notification is shown on every screen of the repository even after dismissing it.

{{Pipelines builds are on hold the rest of this billing period because your team exceeded its 50 build minutes. Change your plan to get more minutes.}}
fields.summary: Pipelines out of minutes notification can't be dismissed
Unable to push

fields.description:
I have checked the comment & try to add reply in the same popup, There are two text editor opened.

Please find the attachment.
fields.summary: While clicking reply from comment popup, Two text editor opened
